;;防暴警察与示威者发生冲突 - 他们手持盾牌在街道对面排队，在紫色灯光下，在翻倒的带轮垃圾箱
;

;在西班牙执政社会党马德里总部外，针对该党计划提供;与加泰罗尼亚分离主义者达成协议;以帮助其确保连任政府。

;

;周二晚上，大约 7,000 人聚集在位于 Calle de Ferraz 的西班牙社会主义工人党 (PSOE) 办公室外，抗议拟议的协议。极右翼 Vox 党和 ;法西斯和新法西斯团体;，导致抗议者和防暴警察之间发生小规模冲突，防暴警察以催泪弹和警棍回应。

;

;视频 ;活动片段显示;一些参与者称西班牙代理首相、社会工人党领导人佩德罗·桑切斯是“王八蛋”、“罪犯”和“独裁者”，并提到了西班牙代理内政部长，费尔南多·格兰德·马拉斯卡（Fernando Grande-Marlaska）——同性恋者——被称为“基佬”。

;

;根据马德里紧急服务部门的说法，;39 人受伤，其中大多数是警察，当局称有 7 人被捕。周一晚上，PSOE 总部外也发生了类似的暴力场面。

; ;

;协议的争议问题在;7月的大选没有结果;，其中，保守派人民党（PP）以微弱优势击败了社会工人党（PSOE）。然而，PP 有;无法筹集必要的支持;来组建政府，这意味着桑切斯及其在;左翼苏马尔联盟;最有可能组建政府。但他们只有在加泰罗尼亚支持独立的两个主要政党加泰罗尼亚左翼共和党 (ERC) 和加泰罗尼亚联合党 (Jints) 的支持下才能做到这一点。

;

;两个加泰罗尼亚政党都表示支持成立西班牙社会工人党 (PSOE)。重返办公室将取决于对参加;2017 年 10 月未能推动脱离西班牙;。虽然 ERC 已达成支持桑切斯的协议，但与 Junts 的谈判仍在拖延。

;

; 桑切斯声称，该协议将有助于促进共存，他表示，党内办公室外的暴力事件是由人民党和 Vox 煽动的，这两家组织都猛烈批评了该提议，并指责桑切斯利用该提议作为一种愤世嫉俗的手段来实现和平共处。继续掌权。

;

;“我们对那些通过行动或不作为支持围攻社会主义场所的人没有任何期望，”他周二晚上在 X（以前称为 Twitter）上写道。 “他们的沉默说明了一切。社会的进步和共存是值得的。他们不会破坏西班牙工人社会党。”

;

;虽然人民党谴责了暴力行为 — — 并强调它既没有组织也没有参与抗议活动 — — 但它表示西班牙人感到愤怒，因为桑切斯“越过了很多界限” ”。Vox 的领导人周一晚上敦促人们来到 Calle de Ferraz，试图将暴力事件归咎于桑切斯和 Grande-Marlaska，称他们命令警察“周一晚上向和平抗议者冲锋并用毒气攻击”。圣地亚哥·阿巴斯卡尔还表示，他的政党将继续支持针对“政变分子……正在谈判消除西班牙共存条件的和平抗议”。

;

;9月中旬的一项民意调查显示;70%的西班牙人反对;特赦，大约20万人反对特赦参加了最近三场反对 PP 和 Vox 组织的大型集会。

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 21:52:01 +0800 Human-caused heating behind extreme droughts in Syria, Iraq and Iran, study findshttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/nov/08/extreme-droughts-in-syria-iraq-and-iran-since-2020

;;一名渔夫走过伊拉克济加尔省沼泽地的一块干燥土地。
;< p>;一项研究发现，如果没有人为造成的全球变暖，自 2020 年以来叙利亚、伊拉克和伊朗数百万人的生活就不会发生严重干旱。

;

;气候危机意味着如此漫长的时间-分析显示，持续严重的干旱已不再罕见。在覆盖叙利亚和伊拉克大部分地区的底格里斯-幼发拉底河流域，这种严重的干旱在全球变暖之前大约每 250 年发生一次 - 现在预计每十年发生一次。

;

;在伊朗，极端干旱过去每 80 年发生一次，但现在在当今炎热的世界中平均每五年发生一次。化石燃料燃烧导致的全球变暖将使干旱更加普遍。

;

;研究还发现，多年战争和政治不稳定造成的脆弱性降低了人们应对干旱的能力，将其变成一场人道主义灾难。

;

;研究人员表示，为未来更频繁的干旱做好计划至关重要。

;

;“我们的研究表明，人为造成的气候变化正在加剧伊朗塞姆南大学的穆罕默德·拉希米教授说：“这已经让西亚数千万人民的生活变得相当困难。” “随着气候进一步变暖，叙利亚、伊拉克和伊朗将成为更加恶劣的居住地。”

; ;

;红十字会与红新月会气候中心的拉纳·埃尔·哈吉 (Rana El Hajj) 表示：“虽然冲突本身会导致土地退化、水管理减弱和干旱，从而增加了干旱的脆弱性。基础设施不断恶化，研究还表明，气候变化，特别是在该地区，已经成为[冲突]的威胁倍增器。”

;

;英国伦敦帝国理工学院的弗里德里克·奥托博士表示：“像干旱这样的干旱这种情况将继续加剧，直到我们停止燃烧化石燃料。如果世界不同意在[联合国气候峰会]上逐步淘汰化石燃料;Cop28;，每个人都会遭受损失：更多的人将遭受水资源短缺，更多的农民将流离失所，许多人将在超市支付更高的食品费用。”

;
;

;;相关：; ;研究人员表示，突发干旱可能会变得越来越普遍;

;
;

;《卫报》在 2022 年披露了数百项科学研究如何表明人为原因;全球变暖正在导致全球范围内发生更加频繁和致命的灾难;。领先;气候科学家警告; 8 月表示，与即将到来的更严重的影响相比，2023 年的“疯狂”极端天气只是“冰山一角”。

;

;;研究;由;世界天气归因;小组进行。研究人员利用天气数据和气候模型来比较自全球变暖导致气温升高约 1.2 摄氏度以来该地区干旱的变化。

;

;科学家发现，自 2020 年以来记录的高温“几乎是不可能的”如果没有气候变化，干旱就会更有可能发生。灼热的气温增加了少量降雨的蒸发，导致美国干旱被列为“极端”干旱干旱监测规模;。如果没有气候危机，过去三年就不会跨过任何干旱门槛。

;

;干旱的影响范围广泛，导致数百万人逃离农村地区、粮食价格飙升、野火和空气污染污染和渔业河流和湖泊干涸。

;

;在叙利亚，200 万农村人口流离失所，据报道 1200 万人（占人口的 60%）面临粮食不安全。伊朗几乎每个省份都受到干旱的严重影响，收成不佳导致粮食价格飙升。

;

;奥托表示：“在气候变暖的世界中，干旱的威胁正在迅速加剧，破坏了生计并扰乱了全球秩序。”

;

;“虽然靠化石燃料变得极其富裕的国家可以支付适应性措施的费用，以便在更炎热、更严酷的世界中享受舒适的生活水平，但在战争后陷入困境的较贫穷国家则不能。对于富裕社会中的穷人来说也是如此，这再次凸显了化石燃料的持续燃烧如何加剧不平等。”

;

;英国石油公司在阿塞拜疆的化石燃料项目为军队提供了资金一个运动组织声称，自 2020 年以来，通过向阿塞拜疆政府转移了数十亿美元，阿塞拜疆对卡拉巴赫亚美尼亚人进行了侵略。

;

;全球见证表示，阿塞拜疆在英国石油公司运营的两个大型石油和天然气项目中所占的份额自 2020 年（纳戈尔诺-卡拉巴赫争议领土爆发战争的那一年）以来，阿塞拜疆政府的军费开支是其军费开支的四倍多。投资者，间接;;帮助资助阿塞拜疆对争议地区亚美尼亚族的军事侵略，这迫使;自 9 月初以来，已有超过 10 万人;逃离该领土。

;

;同月，代表 BP 的高层人士，包括其董事长 Helge Lund和前首席执行官约翰·布朗访问巴库，参加阿塞拜疆已故前总统盖达尔·阿利耶夫的 100 岁生日庆祝活动，并重申其“与阿塞拜疆的长期伙伴关系”的承诺。 bp.com/en_az/azerbaijan/home/news/features/bp-senior-delegation-attend-Heydar-Aliyevs-100th-anniversary-celebrations.html">;公司声明;。

;

;自 2020 年以来，英国石油公司根据“生产分成协议”向巴库供应了价值近 350 亿美元（286 亿英镑）的石油和天然气。

;

;阿利耶夫的儿子伊尔哈姆·阿利耶夫 (Ilham Aliyev) 在其父亲于 2003 年去世后成为总统。欧洲安全与合作组织观察员;声称这次选举未达到国际标准;。全球见证高级活动家多米尼克·伊格尔顿（Dominic Eagleton）表示：“英国石油公司与阿利耶夫‘独裁政权’的长期合作关系为阿塞拜疆的军事化和对亚美尼亚的侵略提供了资金。英国石油公司很高兴继续钻探，但没有从俄罗斯犯下的历史性错误中吸取任何教训。”

;

;英国石油公司放弃了;持有俄罗斯石油公司 Rosneft 近 20% 的股份;，该公司损失了 240 亿美元，在克里姆林宫入侵乌克兰之后，英国政府对英国石油公司与该公司的联系表示担忧，因为该公司在 ;为俄罗斯的军事行动提供燃料;。

;

;“资助暴力独裁者始终是一个糟糕的策略，”伊格尔顿说。

; < p>;BP 上周公布的;利润低于预期;为 3.3 美元第三季度的营收为 10 亿美元，而去年同期为 82 亿美元，这引发了人们的猜测，即其低迷的股价和董事会的动荡可能会使其成为收购目标。

;

;英国石油公司的一位发言人表示，该公司“ “我们在阿塞拜疆已经存在了三十年，我们仍然致力于在该地区运营安全、可靠和有弹性的能源业务”。

;

;根据 BP 与阿塞拜疆政府在 20 世纪 90 年代达成的协议，石油公司公司必须将其从这些项目中生产的化石燃料的一部分交给国家。

;

;这种类型的安排在石油和天然气行业中很常见，作为分担开发风险和回报的一种方式外国公司与东道国之间的化石燃料项目。

;

;英国石油公司（BP）与其他外国石油公司（包括美国公司埃克森美孚、挪威国家石油公司和俄罗斯公司卢克石油公司）一起，在阿塞拜疆石油和天然气项目中占有最大份额。 BP 的财务披露显示，自 2020 年以来，该公司已在全球市场上向巴库供应了价值近 350 亿美元的石油和天然气。这一数字是政府军费开支的四倍多根据斯德哥尔摩国际和平研究所的数据，同期金额达到 79 亿美元。

;

;“我们支持和平解决冲突，并希望很快找到最终解决方案，”BP 发言人添加。布朗没有回应置评请求。

;

;亚美尼亚总理尼科尔·帕希尼扬 (Nikol Pashinyan) 声称，亚美尼亚人的外流相当于“种族清洗和剥夺人民祖国的直接行为”。这一说法遭到阿塞拜疆外交部的强烈否认，外交部表示，该地区居民的大规模迁移是“个人和个人的决定，与强制搬迁无关”。

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 18:52:01 +0800 Timbaland apologises after saying Justin Timberlake should ‘muzzle’ Britney Spears over memoirhttps://www.theguardian.com/music/2023/nov/08/timbaland-justin-timberlake-muzzle-britney-spears-the-woman-in-me
;;2023-11-08T10:23:04Z;
;
;;贾斯汀·汀布莱克 (Justin Timberlake) 和 Timbaland 于 2006 年表演。
;

;音乐制作人 Timbaland 因经常提及他的言论而道歉。合作者贾斯汀·汀布莱克 (Justin Timberlake) 应该在他的前女友布兰妮·斯皮尔斯 (Britney Spears) 的回忆录《我身上的女人》出版后“封住”她的嘴。

;

;廷巴兰 (Timbaland) 于 10 月 29 日在一场谈话活动中与制片人 9th Wonder 交谈时发表了上述评论。华盛顿特区的肯尼迪中心，随后的评论;网上流传;。当一位观众提到这本回忆录时，蒂姆巴兰说：“她快疯了，对吧？我想打电话说，‘JT，伙计，你得给那个女孩戴上口套。’”他用了一种幽默的语气，但贬低性的语言引起了斯皮尔斯球迷的愤怒。

;

;他还建议斯皮尔斯她写的这本回忆录概述了经常造成创伤的事件，包括控制她生活各个方面的长达数年的监管，以“病毒式传播”。

;

;“我们生活在社交媒体的时代，[...]每个人都想走红，”他说。 “我明白了，因为这就是你赚钱、病毒式传播的方式——我必须做一些引起人们注意的事情。”

;

;在 TikTok 的直播中，Timbaland 此后“向布兰妮粉丝道歉，和她。你知道尊重女性——是的。”

;

;In ;我内心的女人;，斯皮尔斯详细描述了她与汀布莱克的关系，她在 1999 年至 2002 年间与汀布莱克约会。堕胎，写道：“如果由我一个人决定，我永远不会这样做。但贾斯汀却如此确信他不想当父亲。”她在谈到他们最终的分手时写道：“尽管贾斯汀伤害了我，但爱的基础却很深厚，当他离开我时，我感到震惊……几个月来我几乎无法说话。每当有人问起我关于他的事情时，我只能哭泣。我不知道我是否处于临床休克状态，但感觉就是这样。”

; ;

;她还写了 R&B 歌手 Ginuwine 和 Timberlake 在男孩乐队“NSync”中的一次邂逅。 “‘NSync 与黑人艺术家一起出去玩。有时我觉得他们太努力地想要融入社会。有一天，我和 J 在纽约，前往我以前从未去过的城镇的一些地方。走在我们路上的是一个戴着巨大的、闪闪发光的奖章的人。他的两侧是两名身材高大的保安。 J 非常兴奋，大声说道，“哦，是的，fo' shiz fo' shiz，Ginuwine，怎么了，老兄？”阅读米歇尔·威廉姆斯 (Michelle Williams) 的有声读物，;该片段已在网上广泛分享;。

;

;Timbaland 制作了四部贾斯汀·汀布莱克 (Justin Timberlake) 的个人首张《Justified》中的歌曲，包括热门民谣《Cry Me a River》——其视频强调了这首歌几乎毫不掩饰地提到了 Spears。

;

;他们的合作仍在继续，Timbaland 制作了第二张专辑 FutureSex/LoveSounds 的大部分内容，第三张专辑《The 20/20 Experience》的全部内容。汀布莱克客串了 Timbaland 的独奏曲目，例如热门歌曲《Give It to Me》和 Timbaland 制作的麦当娜单曲《4 Minutes》；他们还为汀布莱克的最新专辑 2018 年的《Man of the Woods》合作创作了三首歌曲。

;

;在肯尼迪中心的谈话中，9th Wonder 开玩笑说：“我认为我们的白人兄弟姐妹并不观众知道贾斯汀·汀布莱克现在属于我们了，”指的是非裔美国人。 “你知道吗？确实如此，”蒂姆巴兰回答道。 “他是孟菲斯的孩子，很有灵魂。他的妈妈在摩城的很多地方抚养他长大……他来自孟菲斯，Stax，指的是这座城市的灵魂音乐厂牌。

;

;“国家就是国家——白人和黑人之间没有区别，我们都做同样的事情，我们都喜欢灵魂食物……他的妈妈和他的家人，你可能会认为他们是黑人，他们移动的方式，贾斯汀长大的音乐。当他单飞时，他又是一个知道自己想要什么、想成为什么样的人。”

;

;

;伊万卡·特朗普将于今天出现在证人席上她父亲在纽约的 2.5 亿美元欺诈案审判。她将是检方休庭前作证的最后一位家庭成员和最后一位证人。

;小唐纳德·特朗普和埃里克·特朗普兄弟 ;上周作证;，与案件核心的财务报表保持距离，尽管有多份文件显示他们确认了报表的财务陈述，并且有时会就这些报表进行咨询。

;

;“别打扰我的孩子，恩戈隆。你是法律界的耻辱，”他在 11 月 1 日写道。

;

;在司法部长休庭后，特朗普的团队将审查自己的证人名单，他们说可能会持续到 12 月 15 日。审判预计于 12 月 22 日结束。

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 17:52:01 +0800 ‘Inestimable importance’: 500-year-old cache of pressed flowers reveals new secretshttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/nov/08/ulisse-aldrovandi-500-year-old-pressed-flowers-royal-society-aoe
;;2023-11-08T09:00:06Z;
;
;;Scans of Ulisse Aldrovandi's pressed flower species glued to a page of a book
;

;A collection of pressed flowers taken from the hillsides of Bologna 500 years ago is unlocking knowledge about how the climate ccrisis and human migration is changing landscapes in northern Italy.

;

;Picked between 1551 and 1586 by the Renaissance naturalist Ulisse Aldrovandi, the 5,000 delicately cut and dried plants form one of the richest collections of its time.

; ;

;Aldrovandi's original purpose was to identify plant species and understand which could be used for pharmaceutical purposes. Nearly half a millennia later, his carefully pressed specimens are helping botanists document the enormous changes that have taken place in the surrounding landscapes, according to ;new research published by the Royal Society;.

;

;During Aldrovandi's time, Bologna's hills were rich in species that are threatened or have even disappeared today, such as motherwort, which was used for medicinal purposes and is now likely extinct in the region. The total number of the species has increased since 1500s, but the quality of the flora has decreased, with many rarer species declining, researchers said. The Italian population increased by 560% during the study period.

;

;Aldrovandi's herbarium is made up of 15 books, each containing up to 580 specimens glued to sheets. The collection includes notes on species' frequency, abundance, ecology, local names and uses in folk medicine. Researchers believe it is the oldest example of a herbarium containing such detailed notes. “From a historical and scientific perspective”, the researchers write, “the importance of this herbarium is inestimable.”

;

;“Aldrovandi's herbarium preserves the memory of the first signs of a radical transformation of the European flora and habitats,” the paper says.

; ;

;One part of that transformation is the huge influx of non-native species. At the time the collection was formed, just 4% of flowers were American species, which were almost exclusively cultivated in private or botanical gardens. Plants such as sweet pepper and courgettes were imported thanks to early exploration in Central and South America. Since then, there has been a 1,000% increase in non-native flowers from the Americas, which illustrates the growing importance of American-European trade routes from the Renaissance onwards.

;

;“We would never expect to see such a strong difference,” said the lead researcher, Dr Fabrizio Buldrini from the University of Bologna. “These increases are frightening, in some respects, because they are the unequivocal sign of profound human impact.”

;

;Buldrini's team compared flora collected by Aldrovandi with collections made by Girolamo Cocconi (1883) and Emilia-Romagna (1965-2021). They looked at the plains area surrounding the River Po and its tributaries, where they could make comparisons across the datasets.

;
;

;;Related: ;;'Just keep going': the horse-riding 97-year-old botanist battling for England's wildflowers;

;
;

;The data also shows the effects of the “little ice age”, which extended through to the mid-1800s. High mountain species such as the silver cranesbill are typically found more than 1,700 metres above sea level, but Cocconi found it at 800 metres above sea level. The mountain buttercup, today is only found above 1,000 metres, but during the “little ice age” it was found at 300 metres.

;

;Aldrovandi also helped create the city's botanical garden, one of the earliest in Europe. A number of important collections were made around his time and in the centuries after, with Bologna becoming a “sort of cradle of modern botany and herbaria”.

; ;

;Since the 1970s, there has been a project to map the region's entire flora, resulting in a database with more than 500,000 records.

;

;Overall, the discovery highlights the importance of records of dried flowers, the researchers said. “A recent scientific trend is to dismiss these collections, which are regarded as dusty, cumbersome, unnecessary burdens – very expensive to stock and maintain and practically of no use for modern research. There is nothing more wrong: herbaria are indispensable and irreplaceable databanks for many research fields,” said Buldrini.

;

;Global collections contain 390 million specimens, according to the Index Herbariorum. Buldrini added: “Dismissing them would be like dismissing our historical archives, our monuments or our art collections.”

;

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 17:22:02 +0800 UK women top list of world’s biggest female binge drinkers, report findshttps://www.theguardian.com/society/2023/nov/07/uk-women-top-list-of-worlds-biggest-female-binge-drinkers-report-finds
;;2023-11-07T23:48:06Z;
;
;;Female friends clinking beer glasses in a pub.
;

;British women top the list for the world's biggest female binge drinkers, a report has found.

;

;The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) compared alcohol consumption across 33 countries.

;

;The UK was first in the global charts for binge drinking among women – defined as having at least six drinks in a single session – with 26% doing this at least once a month. However, British men were higher, at 45%.

;

;When both sexes were combined, the UK was ranked joint third overall with Luxembourg for binge drinking rates behind only Romania and Denmark.

;

;Dr Richard Piper, chief executive of Alcohol Change UK, said: “Alcohol causes too much harm here in the UK. But this is totally avoidable.

;

;“There is an overwhelming need for the government to introduce measures that we know will reduce alcohol harm and save lives such as proper controls on alcohol marketing, introducing minimum unit pricing in England like we already have in Scotland and Wales, and clearer alcohol labelling.”

;

;The OECD's report also found adults in the UK were more likely to say they vaped compared with other countries, but have lower than average smoking rates. Just 12.7% are current smokers in the UK, compared with an OECD average of 16%. However, almost one in 20 adults (4.9%) said they vaped regularly, compared with an average of 3.2%.

;

;The report also found that the UK spends more on healthcare than comparable countries but has fewer hospital beds and diagnostic tools and pays nurses less.

;

;The UK spends a higher than average proportion of GDP on “health system resources” – spending about 11.3% of its GDP on health in 2022.

;

;Only five countries – the US, Germany, France, Japan and Austria – spend a greater proportion, according to the OECD report.

;

;However, despite being one of the biggest spenders, the UK does not rank favourably on a number of healthcare measures, the report suggested.

;

;Across the countries studied by the OECD, there were on average 4.3 hospital beds for every 1,000 people in the population in 2021.

;

;But in the UK it was 2.4 beds for every 1,000 people, with just Mexico, Costa Rica, Colombia, Chile and Sweden reporting fewer beds.

;

;It also has fewer MRI, CT and PET scanners compared with most of the other countries examined in the OECD's health at a glance report.

;

;The report also concluded that on average across OECD countries, the remuneration of hospital nurses in 2021 was 20% above the average wage of all employees.

;

;But in the UK, Switzerland, Finland and Latvia, nurses made less than the average worker, the OECD said.

;

;Professor Nicola Ranger, chief nurse at the Royal College of Nursing, said: “Politicians should see this as an indictment. On the day the government will only give the NHS a passing reference in the king's speech, the UK is being shown up.

;

;“The NHS is spending the money but not in the right places, like billions on agencies rather than valuing permanent staff.”

;

;A Department of Health and Social Care spokesperson said: “This report uses data from 2021 and since then we have made significant progress to boost bed numbers and diagnostic capacity.

;

;“The NHS has met its target to roll out 10,000 hospital at home beds ahead of winter and is also delivering 5,000 more permanent hospital beds.

;

;“We will also meet our target to open 160 community diagnostic centres a year early, as a result of the largest central cash investment in MRI and CT scanning capacity in the history of the NHS.

;

;“Over one million staff including nurses have received a 5% pay rise for 2023-24 alongside two one-off payments, this is on top of a pay rise worth 5.5% for newly qualified nurses in 2022-23.”

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 16:22:02 +0800 Figure on Led Zeppelin IV cover identified as Victorian Wiltshire thatcherhttps://www.theguardian.com/music/2023/nov/08/led-zeppelin-iv-cover-photo-revealed-victorian-wiltshire-thatcher
;;2023-11-08T00:01:01Z;
;
;;The Wiltshire thatcher, as seen on the cover of Led Zeppelin IV.
;

;For Led Zeppelin fans it is an instantly recognisable image: that of a grey-bearded figure stooping, his leathery hands grasping the pole supporting a bundle of hazel on his back.

;

;But the origin of the image, which forms the centrepiece of the eye-catching front cover of Led Zeppelin IV, has remained a mystery for more than half a century.

;

;Now it has been revealed that it is a late-Victorian black and white photograph of a Wiltshire thatcher.

;

;Brian Edwards, a visiting research fellow with the regional history centre at the University of the West of England, said he came across the image in a photograph album during continuing research extending from an exhibition he curated with Wiltshire Museum in 2021.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Led Zeppelin were asked to do Abba-style avatar act, Jimmy Page says;

;
;

;Edwards's research involved monitoring everyday sources that stimulate public engagement with Wiltshire's past, from paintings and photographs to artefacts and memories. It was while following up on some early photographs of Stonehenge that he came across the one made famous by the English rock band.

;

;“Led Zeppelin created the soundtrack that has accompanied me since my teenage years, so I really hope the discovery of this Victorian photograph pleases and entertains Robert, Jimmy and John Paul,” Edwards said.

;

;Released 52 years ago, on 8 November 1971, Led Zeppelin IV has sold more than 37m copies worldwide, and includes one of the group's most popular songs, Stairway to Heaven.

;

;The album's cover artwork was radically absent of any indication of the band name or a title. The framed, coloured image of the stooped man, which has often been referred to as a painting, was juxtaposed and affixed to the internal, papered wall of a partly demolished suburban house. The back cover of the album was a block of flats, thought to be Salisbury Tower in Ladywood, Birmingham.

;

;It is understood that the Led Zeppelin lead singer, Robert Plant, discovered a framed, coloured photograph of the original image of the Wiltshire thatcher in an antique shop near guitarist Jimmy Page's house in Pangbourne, Berkshire.

;

;The original image was discovered in a Victorian photograph album titled: “Reminiscences of a visit to Shaftesbury. Whitsuntide 1892. A present to Auntie from Ernest.” It contained more than 100 architectural views and street scenes together with a few portraits of rural workers from Wiltshire, Dorset and Somerset.

;

;Beneath the stooped man's image, the photographer wrote: “A Wiltshire thatcher.” Further research suggests the thatcher is Lot Long (sometimes Longyear), who was born in Mere in 1823 and died in 1893. At the time the photograph was taken, Long was a widower living in a small cottage in Shaftesbury Road, Mere.

;

;Meanwhile, a part-signature matching the writing in the album suggests the photographer is Ernest Howard Farmer (1856-1944), the first head of the school of photography at the then newly renamed Regent Street Polytechnic, now part of the University of Westminster.

;

;Farmer's photograph is now in Wiltshire Museum in Devizes, and an exhibition featuring the image, along with others taken in the west of England during the Victorian era, is scheduled to be held at the museum in spring 2024.

;

;David Dawson, the director of Wiltshire Museum, said: “The 'Wiltshire Thatcher: a photographic journey through Victorian Wessex' exhibition will celebrate the work of Ernest Farmer, who today is little known but was a leading figure in the development of photography as an art form.

;

;“Through the exhibition, we will show how Farmer captured the spirit of people, villages and landscapes of Wiltshire and Dorset that were so much of a contrast to his life in London. It is fascinating to see how this theme of rural and urban contrasts was developed by Led Zeppelin and became the focus for this iconic album cover 70 years later.”
